text: Tap @ MBC 2017. Pours deep reddish with a pink head. Aroma of jammy raspberries, light funky, slight minerals, raspberry pits, note of leather. Taste is quite sour, loads of raspberries, barn and funk, very balanced. Good stuff.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Tart and fruity smell with berries. Similar taste. Refreshing.

duft;: hindbær rød saft sødlig frisk
smag. hindbær lime frisk citrus lime lang smag af hindbær
MBCC17; reddish to pink, hazy, pink head; very strong raspberry aroma, some funk and tartness; taste is very fruity, raspberry, gentle sour; very nice

Tap at MBCC. Pours hazy red. Raspberries, tart cherry, funky, barnyard. Fairly tart. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark red with a pink head. Aroma is berries, strawberry and lime. Taste is strawberry, lime and flowers

Really hazy red color with pink head. Aroma has intense unripe raspberries with a hint of grassy yeast funk. Taste is quite sour, really fruity, some fermentation notes, berry pits spicy bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation. Overall its a really fruity and dry sour ale.

Bottle shared. Dark ruby pour, hazy, with a thin pink head. Tons of raspberries, tart fruit, lactic sourness, sour cherries, light raw almonds. Medium body and carbonation, smooth texture and a veeeery tart finish.
Cherry color coats glass. Wow, so much cherry. Very puckering. Mouch is parched after every sip. Tart. Cherry, cherry, cherry.

Draft to stemmed glass. Looks good; a semi-transparent ruby with pink head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; raspberry-forward with well-balanced notes of oak and funk. Tastes like it smells with a tart medium-bodied mouthfeel. Delicious.

Poured from an aesthetically pleasing 500ml bottle. The aroma of jammy raspberries filled the air. Pours a deep ruby red, A pink quickly dissipating head, firmly acidic, lemony, a nice soft funk. The big raspberry and firm acidity are the main focus of this beer. Thanks Daniel.
On tap @ FoBAB 2016. Pour is ruby red with a small white head that fades quickly. Notes of raspberry syrup, sour raspberry mash, tart cherries, dark berry jam, oak, and light brett. Great.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Płynny dżem malinowy. Słodkie, mega owocowe, z przełamującą słodycz kwasowością

The third in the crazy trio bottle share of West Ashley / Blåbær / Atrial Rubicite. Very different from the other two: where West Ashley was drying and full of tannins and Blåbær was old-world and funky, this is bright, fruity, and refreshing. Theres enough acidity to get your attention at first, but any sourness gives way to a huge wave of raspberries that dominates the flavor profile. Extremely tasty and impressive. Cheers, jamesy, for sharing!

Batch 3. Have had a few different batches but all have been awesome. Nose is intense sharp raspberry seed, super tart and fruity, very pleasant on the nose. flavor continues, surprsingly ;), where the nose left off. Big raspberry tartness, a little lambic like complexity. Probably the best American raspberry sour ever.
Strong aroma. Pours with no head on bottle. Nice gentle tartness with lots of raspberry fruit flavor. The sourness lingers nicely. Nice light body. Tasty, dry.

Atrial rubicite 4.9% shared by KL, thanks! 

Blood red with a pink head of foam that left quickly. Blend 5 from 2015 has an incredible nose that is like holding a handful of fresh juicy tart raspberries. Fairly full bodied but insanely tart and super dry. The taste is big huge raspberry, ultra tart, dry and somewhat salty. Great stuff that is mouth puckeringly delicious and can stand among the better framboos out there.

Bottle. Huge raspberry nose, seeds, great tartness, funk. Beautiful deep red color. Wonderfully tart, funky flavor with dust, some yogurt, a bit of salt. Very dry. Great beer that is less sour than a classic framboise and more dry, but would be very interesting beside a LP for example.

2013 / Blend 3 Bottle: Pour is murky red / mahogany with a modest, pinkish white head that dissipates fairly quickly into this glass, leading to a light ring. Theres some feint spotting presence on this one. The nose is jammy as hell - mixed into this is lemon grass notes and an undercurrent of funk that I wasnt expecting either. It is my first Jester King sour - theres a general profile adjust here. Taste : Tart sour notes with a heavier dose of lemon zest and rind, coupled with grassy notes and that sweet raspberry jam and seeds rounding that out. Theres simply a nice level of complexity to this beer. its bright, its somewhat acidic, yet perfectly sweet - yet perfectly funky and perfectly tart - with a dry completion. I can see what all the fuss is about on this one, and this is coming from someone that has zero appreciation for the jester king standard lineup.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016  Blend six just released.  Tap at the brewery.  Wonderful raspberry aroma. The funk comes mainly from acetic acid. Raspberry color with minimal head despite high carbonation. Raspberry flavor with acetic tartness, really really vinegary.. Very dry finish. Good beer but not close to the best sours.

Atrial Rubicite is delicious. Bright in color and taste, this beer is well worth the wait and lives up to the hype. Starts of with a sweetness that gives way to tartness as it warms. If you like fruit sours this is a must have.
Dark intense purplish red color. Strong raspberry jam flavor. Medium mouthfeel. Medium sourness. Long tart raspberry finish.

Bottle at Himmeriget, march 25th 2016. Hazy dark red body, small pink to offwhite head. Aroma is acidic, raspberries, citrus peel, quite zesty! Taste is sour, lots of berries mildening the sourness a bit, tart and dry, pleasing lasting raspberry finish. An excellent beer!

Blend 4 bottle drunk 6/19/16.High clarity and a deep, magenta-tinged red body with a large, well-retained, pink-tinged beige head.Tons of brett, nicely macerated raspberry and very soft wood. Classy and with no heavy lactic/acetic character. Good malt base behind it adding light honey, biscuit and cream-of-wheat character. Black pepper and vanilla from the raspberry seed complete the picture and theres no alcohol or flaw.Very tart with fully fermented raspberry notes that still are quite juicy and have a lush vegetal greenness to them. Soft wood tannins and wheat provide a good backdrop and theres tons of brett intricacy. Lime, hickory nut skin, minimal horseblanket and a strong minerality with black pepper and light lactic acid lingering. Quenching, very drinkable and dry with a very well-done fruit character.

Draft @ Mikkeller CBC 2014.
Hazy, ruby red, light pink head.
Dry, medium body, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Sour, fruity, raspberries, lemon peel, cherries, funk, faint wood. Refreshing, balanced. Very nice! (2014-05 backlog)

375ml bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. 2013 vintage. Pours dark reddish with a smooth small head. Aroma of tart blueberries, sourish notes, funky yeastiness, wood, oak and farmyard. Taste is smooth, sour and tart with loads of blueberry juice, earthiness, mild sourness and wood with some lactic notes, oak and vanilla. Finish is super smooth, slightly tart and sourish with loads of blueberries, oak, wood, vanilla and funky notes. Excellent sour ale, really well balanced and tasty.

Bottle 0.375l at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Vintage 2013. Colour is deep red with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, lactose, dryness, sourness and blackcurrants. Excellent. Amazingly fresh.

Bottle. Deep red clear. Nice malty raspberries, raspberry seedy nose. Some farmyard, all in a pretty nice mix together. Bit tart, mouthwatering, long raspberry finish. Tasty, dry fruity, bit thin in the finish, but overall just excellent.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours raspberry red, clear, with minimal pink head. Aroma is raspberry jam massive, raspberries and more raspberries. Taste is raspberry jam sweet, mild raspberry tart sweet, raspberry pips, slight oak.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a hazy dark ruby color with an average fizzy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy tart berry, wood and sour aroma. Medium to full body with a dry slick texture and flat carbonation. Heavy tart & sour flavor with a heavy berry tart finish of moderate to long duration. Interesting solid beer.

500 ml bottle shared with Tmoney99 thanks to Errl. Pours a slightly hazy deep reddish purple mahogany color with an initially large fluffy pinkish head that settled quickly. The aroma and flavor have big raspberry jam fruity character, tart, oak, tannins, some acidity, I am a big fan of this, this has the pop of a Blushing Monk with the abv of Rubaeus, if I could get this in cans I would drink a ton of this on the golf course.

Older bottle. Pours red with a darker tint, pink head that fades to an ample ring around the glass. Aromas of raspberries, raspberry juice, some light vinegar. Tastes moderately tart, some raspberry juice sweetness underneath and more prominent up front. The raspberries are wonderful; they balance the sour funk nicely. So far my favorite from Jester King. Excellent.

500 ml bottle thanks to T.J on this share! Bottled June 2015. The appearance is beautiful; dark red / ruby color with very thin white head. The aroma is a deep raspberry, raspberry yogurt and light traces of oak.

The taste is is layers of raspberry jam, tart, funky raspberry center with a mildly sharp oak toward the finish. The texture is interesting. It starts jammy and turns bone dry from the oak barrel. The barrel is starting to take over and the sourness is starting to win over the awesome raspberry jam character. 
 I got say this is a beautiful beer and since I am not a huge sour fan, this rides the line of having the barrel and funk take over. Perfect time to open the 2015 (before it becomes to sour). The layers of fresh berry mixed with sour/tart berries is something special.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Poured from bottle 6/20/15 thanks djd07 ruby red color with a nice effervescent fading off white head. Aromas of cherry skins fruity jam and nice sour funk. Taste is raspberry jam tart sour but we?ll balanced and we?ll done. Thanks again djd07.
500ml bottle shared by Chalumeaux. Thanks, TJ! Pours deep ruby with a pink head. Aroma is raspberry, yogurt funk. Flavor is big natural raspberry with some yogurt tart. Really nice!

Bottle. Aroma is just huge raspberry jam mixed with some light funk and cherry skin. Tastes like awesome raspberry purée, light red wine, apple skin and cherry skin. Just an awesome beer. Cant believe I havent had this before.

Bottle from March 2013 - wish I could remember who gave it to me! Ruby pour with a rose head. A nice tart and sour nose, smooth and slightly dusty cherry pit, raspberry seed, some blackberry or elderberry jam. Mild+ carbonation and moderate body, very dry, tart finish, very yummy.

A burgundy red ale with a thin lacing off white head. In aroma, wonderful raspberry jam, light acidity, black berry, beautiful. In mouth, a nice tart raspberry jam with light acidity, light Brett, Epsom salts, light salty notes, wonderful beer. Bottle.

Une scintillante bière rouge voire pourpre assez opaque se verse dans le verre, et la mousse est quasi inexistante. Au nez, cest une véritable purée de framboises avec quelques notes de chêne. Lacidité nest pas trop agressive en bouche et véhicule très bien les saveurs authentiques de framboises. Très sèche et très désaltérante, cest maintenant ma "bière aux fruits" favorite.

750 shared at a tasting. Deep red body. Foamy off-white head. Legit raspberry tones. Puckering US-style tart sour tones, balanced out some and complemented by the thick, sticky raspberry. Quite tasty, very enjoyable.
Bottle. Red pour, with a pink white head. Lots of raspberry, sour, tart berry, raspberry jam, oak, and mild funk. Pretty good.

Bottle. Pours bright red with minimal pink head. Aroma is intense raspberry, pie, a bit of lactic, lots of berry. Taste is full of jammy raspberry, sour throughout, lively. Overall, this is incredible.

Deep purple-red body, thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Intensely sour raspberry, with light oak, some cherries, and a nice tannic finish. Medium bodied, with light carbonation, soft sweetness, and intense acidity. Puckering but matched with sufficient flavor.
Perfect awesome great raspberry and cherry aroma with oak yeast and funk. Flavor of tart fruits and great fizzy to bring it all in one. Complex and well balanced.

Bottle shared with Brian and Dan before leaving FL. Snifters. Pours a deep reddish purple with a slight red head. The aroma is serious raspberry, some sour tartness, slight barrel. The taste is amazing. Serious tart raspberries with oak barrel. Dry finish, slight carb. But the sour raspberries was just spot on. I savored every sip. About as perfect as a beer you can get.
Deep red with a dusting of foam on top. Beautiful fresh raspberry jam aroma. Great tart raspberry flavor, sharp at first, just delicious. Amazing fresh character.
Best beer from Texas. Best beer from Jester King. Seek this out, you wont be disappointed!

(500ml bottle, blended, March 2013 vintage) Pours a clear red body with a small pink head. Aroma of raspberry, oak, barnyard, and leather. Flavor of raspberry, oak, earthiness, grass, lemon, and cherry with a dry finish.

Batch 1. Bottle to glass. Pours a beautiful ruby red color with an off white head. Aroma is tart, raspberry, sweetness. Flavor is phenomenal! Huge raspberry presence, touch of band-aid, funk, sour. Long lingering sweet raspberry tartness in the finish. Excellent!

500ml bottle, batch 1 thanks to Enuratique. Pours hazy deep ruby red with a tiny and quick fading pink head. Aroma is tons of raspberries, funky citric sourness, slight oak. Flavour is tart, medium sour and very crispy. Medium bodied, crispy texture, very lively carbonation. Finish is tart, crispy, raspberries and dry.
Bottle shared on 6/25/15. Pours a hazy, ruby, red. Nose is definitely on the funky side of raspberry. Taste is puckery, sour berries. Asi am a big fan of sour beers, I thoroughly enjoyed this!
Cherry skittles in aroma. Cloudy and chunky floaties. No head pretty flat. May be a poor bottle. Have had better. Especially for JK.

Bottle.Reddish beer with an pinkish head. Sourish raspberry wild strawberries frassy fruity tart citrus aroma. Sourish raspberry grassy wild strawberries tart citrus flavour. Really a refreshing beer :-)
Pure raspberry aroma with grasslands. Cloudy pink. Very tart.sourness rounded by barrelling. A little bandaid in finish.
UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Dark red pour, fair sizes head. Huge raspberry aroma, funk, horse blanket, lighter oak. Jammy raspberry, horse blanket, oak. Medium body. Phenomenal.
Bottle share from Rich. Another killer barrel aged sour, berries make themselves present, mixing with the sour aspects and yeast. Effervesccent , fruity without too much pucker. More of a dry sour.
375ml bottle thanks to rich. Pours out a hazy dark red topped with a pink head. Nose is amazing sweetness raspberry jam wow the nose is amazing. Taste is raspberry sweetness some tart pucker notes.

Pouring at Where The Wild Beers Are 2014. Pours a beautiful garnet ruby with a thin white head. Big raspberries, jammy and tangy. Tart and bright, acid, tartness. Tangy raspberries. Long raspberry finish, big and jam filled.

pink head. dark read pink colour. aroma is massive raspberry, raspberry pits. taste is massive rapsberry, some citric sourness, slight sweet. medium body and carbonation. great, great balance. truly lives up to the hype! delicious. bottle @ ACBF 15

Bottle at Alvinne Craft Beer Fest in Vichte - Belgium March 2015 with markoijelena. Pours dark red, cloudy with a pinkish minimal head. Nose: red fruit, cellar in the background, little stable. Mouth: Cool stuff! Tart and dry, therefore easy drinking. Balanced sour notes recalling rasperries. Perfect for thirst emergency.
Drank this one at the Alvinne Craft Beer festival 2015. Refreshing, but not very special for me. Cherries, fruity, quite sour.

6/III/15 - on tap @ ACBF 2015 (Vichte) - BB: n/a (2015-288) Thanks to all for sharing todays beers!
Clear deep purple to pink beer, small pink head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very very fruity, lots of raspberry, but funky, sweet, sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of raspberries, very refreshing, bit sourish, lovely. Aftertaste: dry, some tannins, little metallic, lemony acidity, lots of raspberries.

At Alvinne 2015. Poured deep reddish purple with a disappearing pink head. Aroma of sweet, but slightly sour, raspberries. Medium body, flavour is moderately sweet raspberry, lightly sour with a lightly bitter finish.

Bottle at Solar Eclipse, Odense. Hazy reddish body with a medium pinkish head. Lots of raspberries, tart, vinegar, light oak notes, yeast. Intense raspberries, funky, dry, vinegar, barnyard, tartness. Complex and super nice.
Bottle @ Solar Eclipse Odense, 2015. Pours Cloudy pink with A White head. Fresh raspberries, fruity and crisp. Intense and fruity. Good sour bite. Barnyard and Wood. Luvly!

Bottle at Solar Eclipse Odense tasting. It pours hazy deep red with a creamy reddish head. The aroma is huge raspberry with some acidic notes. Somewhat sour expression in the flavor with a huge portion of raspberries. Wow. Amazing.

Bpttle 0.75l taste sample at Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015 Vichte Belgium . Pour it ruby red with small white head.On the nose raspberry.Taste and aroma tart,sour fresh raspberries, apple, good complexed.Very good.
@ ACBF 2015. Very fruity beer. A lot of raspberries. Sweet and tart, reminds me of raspberry yoghurt. Notes of vinegar. Refreshing. Very good.

Bottle, pretty sure its batch 4. Pours deep magenta with pink head. Aroma is insane seedy raspberry jam, blackberry, Tempranillo, lemon peel, raspberry leaves, white wine, and an almost savory umami note. Taste is soft strawberry and raspberry with mellow Merlot notes and cherry, red grape, lemon peel, green raspberry leaves, grape leaves, oak barrel. Soft and smooth mouthfeel. Delicious.

Pours clear, dark and deep red . Good pink foam fades rather fast . Scent is intense raspberry , some funk , mild oak , not really sour . 
Taste is sharp , very very full fruity , oak , funk . Sourness is mild and balanced , But nicely intense . Very fruity finish . Bit dry . Good mouthfeel , touch to much carbo but still very nice ! 
Waaw , I never had such an intense yet balanced raspberry beer . Lovely !

UPDATED: APR 6, 2015 At ACBF, classic Jester King product, curious about this. Bright, glowing fuchsia red colour, thin pinkish head. Strong fruitiness as expected, tons of red raspberries with a pleasant perfume, but not sweet; stonefruit, lemon juice, almost agressive fruity acidity in the onset mellowing down to a more yoghurt-like, lactic acidity, smooth but stubbornly drying the finish, with a vinous mouthfeel, rather low carbonation, as fit for this type of beer. This is fruitiness in an almost extreme way, interesting and a must taste for those into sour ales.

Sampled @ ACBF 2015. Pours a brilliant rubine with a light red head. The smell is huge raspberry, raspberry seeds, sweet/sour notes. The taste is Bright, tart raspberries, seeds, tart, sweet/sour ending quite sour. Light+ body with effervescent carbonation. If you love raspberries this beer is heaven.

Draft sample @ ACBF 2015.
De couleur rubis, col fin rosé.
Arôme, tout comme la version Omniscience, fait un très bon usage du fruit. Framboise parfaitement conservée dans son caractère avec un bon résiduel terreux.
Palais est légèrement acidulé avec un très bon côté de framboise. A cela se prête un bon profil de grains et une belle balance des levures sauvages qui restent en retrait par rapport au caractère de la framboise.

I know some people will go mad with this rating, but so be it. I rate beers, not styles. And this is no beer for me for sure. I can imagine some people really likes this kind of bad sour lemonade, but I probably never will understand. Just looking to it, disgusting as a beer. To each his own...
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 Bottle at ACBF. Really sour, but sooo fruity, raspberry explosion, its like juice with alcohol but its fenomenal.

50cl bottle shared with a friend. Smell lots of raspberry and strawberry, malt sugar, candi sirup. Red berried mouth, fruity marmelade, lots of sugar lingers on the palate. My sours are expected to be more.... sour. Nonetheless a beautifully styled bottle and even over sugary, a great raspberry lambic style beer.
Bottle - Brilliant raspberry notes, fresh and sweet. Bright red pink with a bit of bubbly head. Bright raspberry notes, jammy in the best way possible.

Ruby red colour, pink head. Aroma of raspberry, lots of raspberries. Sour, lactic acid, very fruity. Sour flavour, fruity and sweet raspberries, hint of raspberry pips. Quite balanced actually. Finish raspberry, lingering sour. Nice brew, balanced and o so good.(from draught @ CBC green session, Copenhagen 2014. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Bottle. The pour is a vibrant red. The aroma is like sticking your head is raspberry jam or being out picking raspberries. The taste is strong raspberries as well, I feel like I need to get seeds out of my mouth. A very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - Pours ruby with a pink bubbly head. Nose is really pungent rotting raspberry, a little chocolate--really seedy and a big tart. Taste is pungent raspberry, smooth, a little lemon, tart and seedy. Just really well-integrated. Fluffy and soft in the mouth.

500ml bottle into tulip. Park Rapids, MN.

Pours ruby red. no head. Aroma is funky fruit, raspberry, really nice. Taste is tart with subtle undertones. Palate is medium body with clean finish. Gentle carbonation. Overall this beer is really nice. excellent sour

Draught att CBC14. Hazy deep red with oink head.
Lovely aroma of tart fruity raspberries and some other red berries like currants. Smooth lactic tartness in taste with raspberries, yogurth, apples and red berries. Medium bodied and balanced. Very good.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2016 Draught at CBC 14. Deep ruby liquid with medium pink head. Aroma of raspberries, lemon, apples, lacto and other red berries. Lots of raspberry. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of raspberries, lemon and apple skin. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great sour. High raspberry presence and good balance.

Bottle at the hotel lobby fart share @RBWG 2016. Batch 5. Thanks DJ. This is incredible. Concentrated raspberry perfection in a bottle. Aroma upped to ten. Taste to nine.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 Rating 6100! 10/29/14. 500mL bottle with big thanks to djd07! Very deep red pour, almost purple, with a neat fizzy pink head that sadly sizzles away fast with no lacing. Otherwise pretty neato looking. Ive been sipping this for awhile now and contemplating it as it starts to warm slightly, and discussing with Mrs. Owl. Overall, I dig it. Sour, raspberry, it delivers. Now, lets dig deeper. Sourness hits my nose first, definitely sour, lactic, citric, raspberry, etc. Digging deeper, theres a sort of weird meatiness, and surprisingly, given the low-ish ABV, a touch of alcohol popping through. Drinking and sipping for a bit now, the sourness and the raspberry pops and lingers. Pretty tasty, but perhaps a little one dimensionally sour. Reminds me a bit of a chalky Smartie. Tannic, bitter, seedy aspect, jammy. That meaty aspect is hitting me again. Lingers dry and tart with a borderline fecal funkiness. Interesting, tasty.
Sampled @ Exclusive S&G Tasting: Special guest 77ships. APPEARANCE: clouded red beer, small unstable reddish head. NOSE: sour, cherries, wood, nice. TASTE: sour, cherries, wood, nice!
Bottle. Pours a gorgeous garnate color with nice creamy pink head that lasts. The nose is huge fleshy raspberry, seed, oak. Thick mouthfeel jammy raspberry, oak aged jam, wow just amazing.
Tranlucent red with small pink head. Aroma is tart cherries, medium body, medium carbonation, and little small-bubble lacing. Taste is nice rich tart raspberries. One of the best of the night.

500 ml. bottle split by 3 @ Exclusive S&G Tasting: Special guest 77ships. Thanks to Mathieu87 & PriorL. Very nice, long time want. Pours extremely dark pink, small dark pink head; Nose is thick raspberry yoghurt, lots of pits, huge fruit; Taste is thick raspberry pure with lots of pits, thick, nicely tart, light yoghurt sour, faint brett, funk, med. sour, lots of thick fruit, Thick raspberry juice body. Very nice. More straightforward, almost traditional than other Jester King beers.
Bottle thanks to Angelo. Big sour bretty funky aroma. Raspberry and tartness upfront. Very wild and dry at the same time.
Batch 3 bottle pours clear ruby red with low head. Aroma is huge juicy raspberries and light tart. Taste is crisp and clean tart berries with a Dry finish. Could almost be a berry berliner
Damn! This is so complex I'm not sure where to start. The aroma is sour, woody, funky. The flavor is fruity, dry, and tart. Really good.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Red color with nice pink head. Fruity funky aroma, raspberry and some cherry, some wood too. Taste is light sweet and funky fruity sour. Medium body, oily, average carbonation.

shared bottle by a friend. poured a nice slight cloudy red colour with a pink head. amazing aroma of raspberries, marmalade, tart, funk, oak, nice fruity. taste kicks in with full sweet fruit notes of raspberriesbut the sour notes are really complex. boy... i wasnt expecting this! amazing!

Bottle thanks to PreisMJ! Pours deep, hazy red with a small, short lasting, pink head. Aroma has EXTREME amounts of raspberries. Unripe, ripe, tart, and funky raspberries. Really fresh, but with an almost jam-like sweetness to it. Taste has first of all lots of the ripe berries, but with a lovely, crisp tartness. Vinegar, a little rosé wine in the taste, dry bitter wood, leaves you with a perfectly cleansed, sour after taste.. Very big taste compared to many other sours. Pretty full body for style and ABV, but with a crisp carbonation and a fresh sourness. Good stuff!

Bottle shared with vestergaard and rasmusott. Traded with preismj. Deep hazy ruby red with a pink thin head that fizzes away right after pouring. Settles with no head at all. This beer looks amazing. Aromas of tart raspberry, sweet notes of raspberry jam, some yeasty, funky notes. Some floral wine-like notes. Taste is medium tart up front, some sweet matured raspberries followed by some funky stale/hay-like notes in the finish. Cant tell if its the oak that made this beer so damn good, but damn.. damn son, damn.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2015 From trade with Preismj. Pours deep red with no freaking head. Aroma of raspberries - ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? RASPBERRIES IN A BEER????? Yes. Freaking gewd. I also get a lot of funky notes behind this fruit forward freshness. Some vitamins, weak oaky notes and some sweet red wine. Very complex - what is not to like? Taste is quite tart with nice fruit forward raspberries. Both ripe and unripe notes coming along here. Also some funky notes behind this along with some oak, red currants and I almost get rosé wine out of the taste as well. Very nice and highly sniffable beer!

Aroma: Fresh it smells like raspberry jam freshly made
Appearance: Thin Pink head with a nice deep rose color throughout.
Taste: Delicious and jammy when fresh. You taste the raspberries from beginning to end with funk from the middle to end. When this is aged more than 8 months the raspberry fades to the background and the funk comes out to play. Rivals LP Framboise when aged
Mouthfeel. Light/Medium with nice carbonation
Overall: This is probably my favorite fruited American Wild. This beer changes so much over time and only becomes more complex
Pink colored pour. Big pink head. Little bit of lacing. Huge raspberry nose on this one. Some funky notes. Taste is a nice tart raspberry. Excellent.

Bottle. Aroma is Brett with some sweetness and a hint of cherry. Appearance is red with little head. Taste is sweet that takes on some sour. Some cherry present as well. Palate is sour as hell. Overall, a great sour. Will buy more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle share. Thanks Thomas! April 2014 bottle. Cloudy blood red. Aroma of young raspberry jam, vinegar. Taste is tart. Dry finish.

Bright pinkish red with a good pink head. Aroma is fresh raspberry, raspberry syrup, red currants. Medium bodied, tart and fruity on the palate with quite a dry finish. Taste is raspberry, tart red fruits, more raspberries.

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, green session. 03/05/2014. Attractive pink/ purple / red coloured pour with a light pink head. Aroma is tart sharp raspberry, really fruit fruit character. Light funk on the nose. Flavour is fresh raspberry, touch of jam, really fresh fruit. Palate is tart, slight crisp, touch of acid crispness in the finish. Very nice drinkable beer.

The beer is ruby hued with a thin collar. Huge raspberry aroma. Funky character with a jammy raspberry quality. A simple and straightforward beer. Makes me want to revisit Lou Pepe Framboise - its been too long. Delicious and teeming with flavor. So much fruit. Fabulous. My favorite Jester King thus far.

Bottle courtesy of the Mad Fermentationist, thank you sir! Gorgeous bright red ruby color. Amazing aroma of bright fresh raspberries. For taste, my notes just say "wow!" Very glad to have tried this one, since I just missed it on a recent trip to the brewery. Mike said this tasted even better fresh, it must have been pretty spectacular.

Finally getting to try this. Aroma is pure berry, same as the taste. Sour as hell, but in a good way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle traded from Adam. Huge thanks for a huge want here. Batch 2, Aug 2013 poured on 8/2/14. Pours a beautiful ruby red with a small pink head that recedes not long after pouring. So light and drinkable with just the right balance of sweet, tart, and fruity goodness. T - damn this is good. Tart just under ripe fresh raspberries. Like you are eating them right off the bush. Some notes of seeds and the leaves. Lemony tartness rolls to a quietly astringent, musty, horse blanket, wet oak. The end is malty, simple sugary lemon raspberry goodness. Interesting ending notes of apple juice. O - this is easily the best framboise/sour raspberry I've had. 4.4

Brilliant purple in color with purplish head... Aroma of raspberries, jam, oak... Slightly seedy sediment... Flavor is moderately tart, raspberries, oak, funk.... Really well done

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big thanks to DocJ007 for sharing this one with us at one of our recent tastings. Blend #2.


A - Pours ruby red with a nice one finger tall white head, quickly dissipating down to a light film, leaving small streaks of lace down parts of the glass. Goes pretty dead after about five minutes in the glass.


S - Smells of musty basement, bit of horse blanket funk, tart raspberry - both skin and pulp - oak, dash of sugar and a touch of lactic sourness. Berries are strong but so is the musty funk, really nice nose on this one. 


T - Starts off with the strong raspberry tartness quickly being joined by the basement must and barnyard funk. Hints of oak and some sugary sweetness help to keep it all in check. Finish is tart with some sweetness, drying the palate and lingering for awhile after consumption.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Tart, musty feel with some backing sweetness helping to keep it in check.


O - Really impressed by this one. It had everything I enjoy in a raspberry sour and nothing was out of proportion. Really looking forward to visiting the brewery in a few weeks, if their other beers are as good as this it should be an awesome trip.

Bottle thanks to errl poured into a mini-snifter. Pours a rich red with a pink head of foam. The aroma has big, rich, tart raspberries. Tastes of big raspberries. Fairly sour across the board. Damn good beer!
Dark ruby pour with no head. Aroma is extremely earthy tart raspberry. Flavor is huge tart raspberry, very soft at first and turns more sour towards the finish, plum, citrus lingering.

Pours a ruby red with no head. Aroma of raspberry jam, oak and sour wheat. Taste is sour, loads of raspberries, funk and oak. So sour yet so fruity, dry yet juicy. Pretty amazing fruited sour, right up there with very sour blackberry.

Bottle for rate #5800:   Blend One, March 2013:  Deep ruby, deep pink head, foamy, little lacing.   Big strong tart raspberry puree, a touch sweet, but mainly tart.   It reminds me a bit of raspberries just prior to being ripe.   Dry and tart on the tongue, raspberry, but not as big as the nose suggested.   Seems to be a very soft to moderate Sour Ale.   Smooth, a little prickly on the tongue.   Soft dryness, a little tart on the backside, not as strong as I would have liked.   Pretty good, starting to get a bit drier as I drink more.   Finishes somewhat quickly, quicker than I wanted.   Pretty tasty tho!
500 ml. bottle. Blend 1. Thanks Mike! Pours a lovely burgundy with a small ruby head. Aroma of raspberries, earth, and funk. Taste is tart raspberries, funk, earth, and some wood. Delicious.

Blend 2 bottle courtesy of beer_no_evil. Pours a sparkling deep rose red. Fine carbonation bubbles slide up the side of the glass. Smells of slightly burnt rubber, syrupy raspberry and sharp acidity. Taste is a bit thinner than I expected. Very tart, very acidic. The raspberries are very sharp and very vineous in character. Almost too acidic for my tastes. I get a bit of oak from the barrel character in the tail end. This could mature nicely though.

Ruby color, little white head. Intense musty raspberry aroma, just insanely good aroma. Flavor is very nice, but doesnt match the intense fruitiness of the aroma. Still absolutely fantastic. Amazing beer.

Bottle shared by a kind soul at PaulUnwins birthday. Pours a hazy red-brown with a small white-ish head. Nose is earthy berries, tartness, some malt character, some vinous character, some oak, and some sour bite. Flavor is similar with oak, tart berries, and some red wine character, and some more berries with a sour bite. Acidic, but balanced and very enjoyable overall.

!WARNING! The following is a morning after tick--passed out during tasting, awoke to find two murky inches remained in bottle. Score. Pours dark ruby, thin white film dissolves fast leaving slight ring. Breathing for 12hr reveals the brightest berry nose Ive sniffed (maybe Blue Cheer), glorious raspberry and no stinging arsenic, sparkling and jammy without sugars dominating. Flavor similarly one-note, not as rounded with the berry expression and more masking sweetness. a champagne levity throughout is matched by the drying, lightly puckering finish that rides on pillows of lactic softness. Delicious end to one of the most quaffable of the new-gen sours, even if admittedly simple at times. Block 15 Framboise is the closest comparison.

Pours deep red burgundy with a small head. Nose is really juicy raspberries, not just seeds, meaty and juicy. Light kiss of oak, acidity, wild yeast. Flavor is more seed forward, acidic, dry raspberry. Still bright, with champagne like carbonation. Pretty good, but it wont improve with moire age, should be drank now.

1900th review! Got in a trade with cyde. 500 ml bottle into signature tulip glass; Blend 2, bottled in August 2013. Pours slightly hazy deep ruby red color with a 1 finger fairly dense pink head with poor retention, that reduces to a small ring of lacing. Minimal glass lacing and a fair amount streaming carbonation. Great color and clarity. Aromas of huge tart raspberry, raspberry skin, sour cherry, red grape, green apple, oak, clove, pepper, leather, red wine, vinegar, hay, straw, herbal, musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with big raspberry presence and great yeast/oak balance; with great strength. Taste of big tart raspberry, raspberry skin, green apple, sour cherry, pear, red grape, oak, clove, hay, straw, leather, red wine, musty funk, light vinegar, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Moderate amount of fruity/earthy tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart raspberry, green apple, red grape, pear, sour cherry, oak, clove, red wine, hay, straw, light vinegar, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic complexity and balance of raspberry, oak, and yeast ester flavors; with a great sweetness/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth, crisp, and moderately acidic mouthfeel that is fantastic. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an insane raspberry sour ale! All around fantastic complexity, balance, and robustness of raspberry, oak, and yeast flavors; and very smooth to sip on with the moderate acidity. An extremely delicious and well balanced offering.

Bottle poured into a tulip. Pours deep ruby with a pink head. Aroma of raspberries, sourness, and some pale malts. Flavor the same with a lot of raspberries and sourness. Average texture. A good beer.

375mL bottle, pours a beautiful opaque raspberry red with a small pink head. Aroma brings out pure raspberry explosion in your face, along with brett and funk. Flavour brings out loads of raspberry jam, brett, and barnyard funk. Incredibly complex, with the fruit sinking front and centre, along with the bretty funk. Outstanding stuff of remarkable complexity. Phenomenal - just an incredible beer of amazing complexity.

Tap. Pours hazy reddish pink, small pink head, decent lacing . Aroma is raspberry, funk, horse blanket, fruity, wood. Flavor is medium plus tart, lightly funky, very fruity with a dry finish. Medium body, low carbonation. Some wood notes, but little astringence. Nice, compares favorably to rose de gambrinus.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2015 Batch 1 bottle from Errl! Chris, you rock! Enjoyed with Thanksgiving leftovers. Worked well with the cranberries and rich gravy as well. Pretty pinkish purple. Massive sweet stewed raspberry nose, unbelievable. Taste is tart raspberry with nice tart acidity. Not terribly long, but pure, dry fruit, with some oak. Great but a bit of a let down after the nose in terms of complexity. Terrific beer regardless.

>>>Batch 4 in May 2015.  Again from my main man, Errl!  Bumping up rating from 4.1.  Massive fresh and jammy raspberry nose, some vegetal woody stems, light soft cheese aromas.  Taste follows, with woody elements really balancing out the pure fruit.  Much more complex than I remember Batch 1 being.  5 out of 5 preferred this to 3F Framboos in a tasting owing to the complexity.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 [Bottle / Blend 1] Thanks, Nick! Blood red, deep crimson color, very dense & nearly opaque in the center with a lavish, lavender & pink colored head. Aroma explodes with juicy raspberry puree, jam essence with freshly pounded raspberries all around. Good sour vibe with some light lacto sharpness, faint acidity with a touch of residual sweetness for balance. Taste starts with dense raspberry; juicy & pureed. Starts off sweet, but grows with a mild acidity throughout, until you reach a sharp & tart finish. Very light notes of vinegar with a heavier balance of oak & wood. Mild acidity adds to the sharpness but wont tear your guts up. Awesome brew, never had raspberries this fresh & pure in a beer before.
[Blend 2] Had a bottle of Blend 2 & there was definitely a bit more stink cheese & sweatsock funk on the nose, which I loved. Still plenty of raspberry jammy jam goodness; pure, sour, fresh, light yogurt. A great raspberry wild ale.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland for prying this out of a Texans hands ! Pours a deep rich ruby red color with a finger of pink foam. The nose is deep ripe raspberry jam, wet spicy oak funk and a touch of vinous musk. The palate follows with huge raspberry essence, not a whole lot of sweetness but more a ripe tart berry flavor with complexity added by some spicy oak notes with touches of vanilla and a puckering dryness to finish it off ! Pretty damn tasty.

500ml bottle (blend 1) pours dark ruby red with a finger of pink head. Nose is huge berry, tart juice, musty, and some funky oak notes. Taste is tart sweet berry, funk, fruit punch, jam, barrel notes. The rasberry is turned up to 11 in this. Finish is sweet, tart, fruity funk. Tasty fruit bomb.

Bottle at Tony/Jim BA Birthday Extravaganza 2013 (Western Springs, IL). Pours a nice deep ruby reddish hue, crimson berry darkness with nice haziness. Frothy whitish pink head is mellow, a nice ring sticks around, laces ok. Aromas are rich raspberry, dark and pulpy with seedy fruit, lactic sourness, lemon, tart and enjoyable. Some gentle oak, touches of funk and cobwebs. Initial is tart, nicely sour with fruity raspberry, tart sourness meets some cobwebs, tannic raspberry skin, a bit seedy. The funkiness dies out, a bit darker and. Touchs weet in the middle. Backend is a bit pulpy, sweetn black raspberry juice with some cherry, touches of tartness taper out, a bit tannic, raspberry skin. A bit funky with some cobwebs, gentle lactic yogurty feel and berryskin as we finish. Nice stuff. Rich, flavorful, the cobwebs a bit firmer as we get into it. A touch pulpy, tannic. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 Bottle, Blend 2: August 2013. Aroma is full of seedy blackberries and fresh raspberry. There is a bit of an acidic note, but mostly very fruit forward with no funk. Can almost pick up on some oak. Pours a deep pink/purple with an attractive purple bubbly head. Nice head retention that sits on top of the liquid for quite awhile. Flavor follows aroma - with moderate acidity and medium raspberry jam notes. There is plenty of blackberry and dark grape notes in the flavor as well. The finish is fairly dry, with medium high carbonation, with a somewhat thin mouthfeel. Very sticky sweet candy notes lingers on the tongue. I find the flavors to be a little one dimensional with the absence of some kind of funk. The fruit sweetness kind of washes out the barrel or bug complexities that may have rounded out this beer for me. Overall a very enjoyable sour.

Been holding off on rating this one for months, despite attending the release and having multiple draft & bottle pours of both batches. I do my best not to overuse hyperbole, and I don't want to be a homer, so I've waited to collect my thoughts before publishing them. It's time. 

Fresh raspberries pummel my nose far away from the bottle. Mildly oaked at the end, adding a touch of complexity to this already impressive aroma. My very first impression of smelling this brew was unknown to me at the bottle share before the release. It was handed to me in a glass, and I asked, "Is this Cantillon?" Yeah, it's THAT good. 

And the taste delivers. Waves of deliciously fresh raspberries bombard my taste buds, accented by a baseline oak character and hints of yeasty funk. Damn. I actually prefer this to St. Lamvinus. Wtf?! 

I may be a bit of a Freetail fanboy, but goddamn, this is nothing short of game-changing for Texas beer. And maybe American sours in general. I truly could not recommend this more highly, but my remaining bottles are simply not for trade. Atrial is one of the absolute best sours I've ever had. Cheers!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2013 (500ml bottle batch 1) exceptionally dark ruby red, pink bubbles. Nose of funk, raspberry purée, fresh field greens, red wine, Pedio. Taste of raspberry purée and seeds, tart but not puckering or sour, really complex and well done. 

Have had both blend 1 and blend 2. Im not sure which I prefer, I think theyre both unique. Blend 1 already feels like the more mature beer, and its no surprise since its 4+ months older but aging has already had an impact. Blend 1 is more complex, funky, and the brett is more forward. Blend 2 is much more fruit forward and smells and tastes more like fresh raspberries, rather than the seeds. I think if I was drinking a lot of it, blend 2 would be my preference. To sit and enjoy only one though, blend 1 would be my pick for the complexity factor.

Sampled both from a bottle pre-release and on tap at Jester King during the official bottle release. Truly exciting to experience Jester Kings first bottle release!

4 oz pour into a stemmed wine glass. Served around 50 degrees F and allowed to warm in the hot TX shade.

Appearance is the first thing that you notice about most beers. This brews radiant deep, ruby red hue is no exception. Theres no real head by the time I get my glass out the door and sit down to start considering its magnificence, but there are scattered whitish bubbles on the surface. Its worth mentioning again; the color is surreal and beautiful.

Smell is the beers weak point. Straight on raspberry with a hint of rubber and definite sourness. Thankfully the raspberry smell is pure fruit, no extract or synthetic. Still, not as rich as Id imagine.

Taste is outstanding. Ripe, tart deep red raspberries with a bracingly sour acidity. Imagine eating perfectly ripe raspberries atop homemade raspberry jam, then chasing with lacto and pedio souring bacteria that havent overkilled the product youre consuming. Thats what this is. Amazing raspberry clarity in the taste. I wish someone had brought a Rose de Gambrinus so I could try them side-by-side.

Mouthfeel is also outstanding. Fuller bodied than most sours, thanks (Im guessing) to the substantial fruit presence in the beer. This is nearly syrup-y in texture, which makes it more enjoyable in my opinion. Theres definite carbonation throughout.

All in all, this is Jester Kings maestro performance to date. Call me a homer, but Ive traveled and consumed Rose de Gam at its source in Brussels and I think this beer is on par. In terms of TX beer, papas got a brand new bag.
